question: Based on the given evidence, is the hypothesis 'Ho is an investor or is not an ardent communist.' true, false, or uncertain? The final answer should be 'True', 'False', or 'Uncertain'. Only answer 'Uncertain' if the reasoning results from different evidences conflict with each other.

content.source_1: Every attendee at the business conference is an investor or an entrepreneur.
content.source_2: No attendee who enjoys the opportunity of starting a business prefers a planned economy.
content.source_3: Every entrepreneur at the business conference enjoys the opportunity of starting a business.
content.source_4: Any attendee who enjoys state ownership of the means of production prefers a planned economy.
content.source_5: Any attendee who is an ardent communist prefers state ownership of the means of production.
content.source_6: Ho is attending the business conference.
content.source_7: Ho prefers state ownership of the means of production.
content.source_8: Attendees who prefer state ownership of the means of production also enjoy state ownership of the means of production.
content.source_9: Ardent communist attendees enjoy the opportunity of starting a business.
